image.altText: Damage to a causeway along the South Australian coast.

props.synopsis: While wild weather has caused damage to coastal areas, the rain has brought some relief to farmers — but they say far more will be needed to break the drought.

title.children: Storm damages historic causeway but farmers still await 'miraculous recovery'

image.altText: Firefighters and police standing on a beach in front of rocks, holding a green plastic sheet

props.synopsis: A 29-year-old man has died after he was found floating in waters off O'Sullivan Beach in Adelaide's south on Thursday, police say.

title.children: Man, 29, drowns off O'Sullivan Beach in Adelaide's south

image.altText: Parts of a regional highway that shows both sealed roads and washed away portions

props.synopsis: Businesses and pastoral stations in the Channel Country region of far-north-east South Australia could be stranded for up to eight months, after Cooper Creek's only barge was taken away for servicing two years ago.

title.children: Residents still cut off by floodwater angry over lack of planning

image.altText: A woman speaks at a dais in front of a corrugated iron wall inside a buildikng

props.synopsis: Danni Smith has appeared in court charged with assaulting a current or former partner. She says she will fight the charges and they have nothing to do with the Voice.

title.children: SA Voice to Parliament joint leader on domestic violence charges

image.altText: A woman signing Auslan in front of a colourful flag with a lit up stage in the distance

props.synopsis: While familiar at emergency announcements and press conferences, Auslan interpreters are now becoming increasingly common at concerts.

title.children: Why interpreting live music through Auslan is about more than just lyrics

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man in a cap wearing a black shirt with thick metal necklaces smiling in a gym.

props.synopsis: The ATO is taking legal action against founder of popular gym chain Derrimut 24:7 Nikolaos Solomos, over an alleged multi-million-dollar tax debt.

title.children: Gym chain owner once shot at by rivals facing $11 million tax bill

image.altText: Two cars parked outside a building with sign 'Little Shining Stars Early Learning Centre', a parent walks out of glass doors

props.synopsis: Parents at an Adelaide early learning centre under investigation have shared mixed views, as data reveals a number of centres have failed to comply with national laws since June.

title.children: Parents of Klemzig early learning centre speak out amid investigation

image.altText: Ben Keays

props.synopsis: The AFL fines Ben Keays and Josh Rachele after the two Adelaide players repeatedly ignored directions to not wear metal studs on their boots.

title.children: Crows players fined after ignoring directions to not wear metal studs

image.altText: Dad of patient looks through an octogon shape beaming at the camera

props.synopsis: A South Australian theatre group has devised a new show, The Lensical, that provides young long-term patients with a thrilling bedside spectacle.

title.children: This beautiful performance takes place at the end of a hospital bed

image.altText: a man and woman smile at the camera with their arm around each other whilst holding rowing ores and kayak paddles in other hand

props.synopsis: After four months of dust storms and chilblains, Anja Wever and Cy Wever-Jetis say giving up was never an option.

title.children: Mother-son duo first to travel entire 2,500km of Murray River

image.altText: Separate images of Don Gail and Heather on a coloured background with mushroom graphic in the corner

props.synopsis: The victims of Erin Patterson's deadly beef Wellington lunch are being remembered for their altruistic nature and kind hearts, just days after a jury convicted their killer of murder.

title.children: 'Model citizens' murdered by Erin Patterson leave legacy in Korumburra

image.altText: chad Cornes announce retirements

props.synopsis: The club has told the 45-year-old assistant coach he won't be returning for the 2026 AFL season.

title.children: Former Premiership player Chad Cornes let go by Port Adelaide

image.altText: South Australia Livestock Exchange 2025-06-03 09:06:00

props.synopsis: Australia's sheep flock continues to decrease due to drought, with ewe numbers expected to drop 9 per cent over the next year.

title.children: Record lamb prices continue as Australian sheep flock shrinks further

image.altText: Willie Rioli walks off the ground

props.synopsis: Willie Rioli speaks candidly about a tumultuous couple of months he endured this season, admitting he spoke to his manager on multiple occasions about retiring from the AFL.

title.children: Rioli considered retiring as racism and off-field drama became 'a bit too much'

image.altText: A large build up on cloud like foam on a beach.

props.synopsis: South Australian commercial fishers can apply to have licence and other government fees waived if their catches have been impacted by the state's toxic algal bloom, which has now spread to the Port River.

title.children: Fishing sector to have fees waived amid algal bloom, which has now spread to Port River

image.altText: A body of water in the middle of a gorge, with blue sky overhead.

props.synopsis: Police divers have located the body of a 57-year-old man after he slipped beneath the water while swimming at Edith Falls, near Katherine.

title.children: Police recover body of tourist from popular NT swimming spot

image.altText: A Lamborghini the company purchased in January 2023 for $548,000.

props.synopsis: Six thousand First Guardian investors have been told by the fund's liquidator there may be insufficient funds to pay back the superannuation funds they invested.

title.children: First Guardian investors may never see their super, say liquidators

image.altText: A CCTV camera attached to a wall.

props.synopsis: There's a crisis of trust in childcare but experts say the answer is to increase staffing and training.

title.children: 'People want something done fast' but CCTV is not the answer, childcare experts warn

image.altText: Several explosions bursting out of the water around a large cargo ship.

props.synopsis: Iran-backed Houthi rebels have attacked and sunk a cargo ship travelling through the Red Sea, killing some crew members and leaving others adrift in the water.

title.children: Houthi rebels launch deadly attack on Red Sea cargo ship

image.altText: Flames rise in Gaza

props.synopsis: The move comes after four days of indirect talks between Hamas and Israel, as the US signals its belief that an agreement for a 60-day truce will be struck before the end of the week.

title.children: Hamas agrees to release 10 hostages as part of Gaza ceasefire talks

image.altText: Abhishek Shukla wears glasses as he sits in an empty room and takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: An Australian academic who made a film about the dark side of social media manipulation has been arrested by Indian police over allegations he fleeced a divorced woman.

title.children: Australian man accused of fleecing woman of $645k in alleged marriage scam

image.altText: A man in a blue suit stands behind a lectern with his arms out to his sides gesturing while speaking to someone out of frame

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump sends letters to more countries outlining new tariff rates that will come into effect next month unless they agree to new trade deals.

title.children: Trump reveals 50 per cent tariff rate for Brazil

image.altText: Novak Djokovic plays a shot between the legs at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Chasing a 25th major singles title, Novak Djokovic gets past Flavio Cobolli in the quarterfinals, while world number one Jannik Sinner also wins through to the last four.

title.children: Djokovic survives early scare to set up Wimbledon clash with Sinner

image.altText: Nvidia logo displayed on a mobile phone screen with a circuit board in the background.

props.synopsis: A milestone for Nvidia has boosted the market mood overnight. The ASX is poised to follow Wall Street higher. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Chipmaker Nvidia becomes first company to hit $US4 trillion

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian miners shrug off Trump tariffs as ASX closes higher
US 50pc copper tariff to take effect on August 1
Payday lender Cigno and BSF Solutions appeal bid dismissed

image.altText: A large sign saying Austin on the side of a grey building.

props.synopsis: Detectives have charged a trainee surgeon with stalking after his colleagues found a camera allegedly recording them in a staff toilet at a major hospital.

title.children: Junior doctor charged after camera found in staff bathroom at Melbourne hospital

image.altText: a exterior image of a Lactalis factory with the company's logo on the wall and a sign pointing to the entrance

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission green-lights the merger of two of the country's largest dairy processors, saying a substantial change in market dynamics is "unlikely".

title.children: Dairy giants given go-ahead to merge

image.altText: CFMEU members surround AWU delegates

props.synopsis: Queensland's former Labor premier says he was not aware of threats made by CFMEU members to government ministers, after a report found the state branch used violence to further its agenda.

title.children: Labor leader says report into CFMEU branch 'deeply concerning'

image.altText: A koala moves along the ground with a black and red cube, about the size of its nose, attached below its chin.

props.synopsis: Koalas spend 20 hours a day sleeping, and most of the rest eating. But a new study focuses on a tiny fraction of the day when they're at their most vulnerable.

title.children: Koala trackers log deadliest 10 minutes of the day for iconic animals

image.altText: GettyImages-2219353366

props.synopsis: Geelong's game plan evolves each season, but there are common elements that make the Cats finals contenders on a regular basis.

title.children: Why the Cats are again in the hunt for the AFL flag

image.altText: A man in a dark suit, white shirt and red tie, half in shadow, entering a building.

props.synopsis: A South Korean court has approved the new arrest of former president Yoon Suk Yeol, sending him back into detention.

title.children: Former South Korean president back in detention after fresh arrest warrant

image.altText: An email reads: "1 new myGov notification. 1 new Secure message(s). To Review please click on the View message button below

props.synopsis: Scammers are poised to capitalise on the eagerness and financial anxiety of Australians during tax time. Here's how to keep your information safe.

title.children: Received messages claiming to be from the ATO or myGov? It could be a scam

image.altText: A woman with short grey hair, wearing a dark suit jacket over a white shirt, looks intently into the camera.

props.synopsis: Former RBA assistant governor Luci Ellis warns an "unconfident" RBA risks falling into persistent policy error.

title.children: 'Unconfident': RBA risks falling into persistent policy error, warns former assistant governor

image.altText: Christian Horner speaks with one of his drivers at the Canadian F1 Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: Christian Horner gives an emotional farewell to staff after being sacked as Red Bull's Formula 1 boss.

title.children: Horner says leading Red Bull was 'biggest privilege'

image.altText: Superman stands in an icy cave in front of big, metal doors

props.synopsis: After the success of his Guardians of the Galaxy trilogy, director James Gunn brings wisecracks, cartoonish violence and sincerity to America's marquee superhero.

title.children: DC Studios attempts a reputation reset with light and fun Superman
